alert.note: Alert for Warren (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 12 at 4:12AM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A line of showers with strong winds will impact portions of northwestern Warren, southeastern Carbon, Monroe and northern Northampton Counties through 500 AM EST... At 411 AM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a line of showers with a history of producing strong winds extending from Greentown to near Palmerton. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Mount Pocono, East Stroudsburg, Tobyhanna, Blairstown, Nazareth, Palmerton, Bangor, Slatington, Pen Argyl, Wind Gap, Belvidere, Walnutport, Belfast, Tatamy, East Bangor, Stormville, Werry Lake, Pocono Pines, Millbrook and Skytop. This includes the following highways... Northeast Extension between mile markers 72 and 74, and between mile markers 77 and 78. Interstate 80 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 290 and 314. Interstate 80 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 9. Interstate 380 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 10. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
